basics.name: Deondre Do
basics.label: Data Scientist & Bioengineering PhD Candidate
basics.summary: Data Analyst and Scientific Researcher specializing in automated medical imaging pipelines, quantitative biomarker validation, and computer vision for healthcare impact.

work.name: University of California, San Diego
work.summary: Leading multi-center clinical validation of RSIrs biomarkers and engineering automated MRI-CT registration pipelines.
highlights: Validated RSIrs as a cancer biomarker using data from 1,890 patients across 7 institutions.
Achieved AUC 0.77 for cancer detection, significantly outperforming the clinical standard (0.51).
Developed PrecisionPro Fusion, reducing MRI-CT registration time to under 15 minutes.

work.name: UCSD Center for Multimodal Imaging & Genetics
work.summary: Managed secure data transfer infrastructure and IT support for clinical research deployment.
highlights: Configured Linux servers for secure, multi-institutional data transfer.
Authored Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for IT workflows and server setup.

volunteer.summary: Mentoring undergraduate students in medical imaging research and data science workflows.

awards.title: 3 First-Author Manuscripts
awards.awarder: Technical Innovations & Patient Support in Radiation Oncology
awards.summary: Authored multiple high-impact studies on clinical validation and algorithm optimization for MRI systems.

publications.name: PrecisionPro fusion: Clinical validation of an automated MRI-CT Fusion system
publications.publisher: Technical Innovations & Patient Support in Radiation Oncology
publications.summary: Automated pipeline using Python/MATLAB to synchronize multi-modal imaging data for clinical radiotherapy planning.

publications.name: Robustness of a Restriction Spectrum Imaging (RSI) quantitative MRI biomarker
publications.summary: Study of 1,890 patients evaluating the robustness of RSIrs against age, race, and hardware variations.

projects.name: Folioverse
projects.summary: Cross-platform TCG inventory application using proprietary Computer Vision scanners to automate card logging and market analysis.
highlights: PyTorch-powered pipeline for real-time card set detection.
Scalable SQL database managing thousands of unique card permutations.
Integrated real-time financial dashboards for hobbyist collectors.
